taskbody.context: This task describes how to find and open a model by searching for its name or looking for a given domain element like application. This is very helpful when you only have the name and not the location.

step.stepresult:
The Open Model ELement dialog is displayed. The dialog box is composed by two filters and a list of matching items. Each list item presents two parts separated by "-":
The element name
The element type

step.cmd: Use the first text field to filter the model element name. The string you enter filters all model elements containing the input string in its name.
Use the second text field to filter the model element type.
step.info:
You have the following different available types:
Domain elements:
MdfDomain: domain model.
MdfClass: application or multi-value and sub-value group definition.
MdfAssocation: reference to application or association by value to multi-value or sub-value group.
MdfEnumeration: List of possible values.
Enquiry: enquiry model.
Version: version model

step.cmd: Select the line in the matching item list and click on OK button to open the model.

taskbody.result: The selected model is opened with the DSL editor.
